headline: Will Major Partnerships Boost NextDecade’s (NEXT) Competitive Edge in LNG Development?
summary: In recent weeks, TotalEnergies announced a 10% stake in the joint venture developing Train 4 of NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG project in Texas, while Baker Hughes secured a contract to supply main liquefaction equipment and ConocoPhillips signed long-term purchase agreements for LNG from the facility. This wave of major industry partnerships points to accelerating commercial momentum and diverse stakeholder commitment at NextDecade’s flagship development. We’ll explore how TotalEnergies’...

headline: Baker Hughes Awarded Contracts by Bechtel, Petrobras
summary: Baker Hughes' scope for Port Arthur LNG phase 2 includes four Frame 7 turbines paired with eight centrifugal compressors across two LNG trains.
